intro: Corydalis flexuosa subsp. kuanhsiensis, commonly known as the Kuanhsi Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. The plant has slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
